subject: Management
title: Measuring Culture
description: A quick win: understand Measuring Culture.

hook.text: A company thought its culture was excellent. An anonymous survey revealed 60% felt psychologically unsafe.

buildup.text: You can't improve what you don't measure. But culture feels too soft to quantify.

discovery.text: Pulse surveys, eNPS, retention analytics, and exit interviews can make culture visible and trackable.

twist.text: The measurement itself changes culture. When you ask, people know you care. That matters.

climax.text: Survey quarterly. Share results transparently. Act on one finding each cycle. Close the loop.

punchline.text: Ask the question. Share the answer. Fix one thing. Repeat.

quiz.question: How can organizations measure culture effectively?
options: Using pulse surveys, eNPS, retention data, and exit interviews regularly
Culture is impossible to measure with any tool or method
Annual performance reviews are sufficient for understanding culture
